Full name: John William Naylor
Formerly 3/32522, North Staffs Regt.

comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Best match [so far found].
John William [aka Willie] Naylor Born 1890. Recorded in the 1891 census as 10 months old [the 1891 census was taken at midnight on 5th / 6th April 1891] and living with his parents at 10 Canal Road, Sowerby Bridge, Yorks.. He is the oldest child of, ultimately, five children [3 boys, 2 girls] from his father’s first marriage.  His father’s [b. 1869, Manchester] employment is recorded as Gas Works Labourer. His mother, Sarah Grace Naylor nee Walton [b1869 Mytholmroyd, Yorks.] died in the second quarter of 1917, so, round about the same time as her  son.
By the time the 1901 census was taken his family are still living at the same address but by  then his father is employed as a Railway Signalman.
His marital home was 4 Newton Street, off Tule Lane, Sowerby Bridge, Yorks. The premises  are still extant. 
Below is a composite of shots from Google Earth and Street View. The upper part of the picture
 shows the location of his childhood home in Canal Road. The lower portion shows the location 
of his marital home with a close-up. Click on the picture for a large version, it's a large photo so may take a while to load.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits/6345505004/in/photostream]
